com.ibm.team.scm.common
Interface IFlowTable

public interface IFlowTable

Represent a table of flow entries describing nominal flows between the owning workspace and any number of targets.

Since:
0.5

Method Summary
 java.util.List acceptSources()
          Returns all accept sources in table.

Method Detail

getWorkingCopy

IFlowTable getWorkingCopy()
Returns a modifiable copy of this flow table.

Returns:
the copy; never null

deliverTargets

java.util.List deliverTargets()
Returns all deliver targets in table.

Returns:
an unmodifiable list of deliver targets (element type: IFlowEntry; never null

acceptSources

java.util.List acceptSources()
Returns all accept sources in table.

Returns:
an unmodifiable list of accept sources (element type: IFlowEntry; never null.

addDeliverFlow

void addDeliverFlow(IFlowNodeHandle target,
                    UUID remoteRepoIdentifier,
                    java.lang.String remoteRepoURI,
                    java.util.Collection componentScopes,
                    java.lang.String description)
Creates a flow entry (with description) adding the given workspace as a deliver target, and declaring a list of component filters (can be empty) to be used when determining which change sets to be delivered.

Parameters:
target - flow node to serve as the accept source for the entry; cannot be null.
remoteRepoIdentifier - : the identifier which represents the repository id for the deliver flow target if the the deliver target is from a different repository
remoteRepoURI - : the expected repository uri which represents the URI for the deliver flow target if the the deliver target is from a different repository
componentScopes - collection (element type: IComponentHandle) which specify the additional component-scoped targets for flow; null implies no component scopes
description - client specified description to associate with this flow entry; null is permitted
Since:
0.7

addAcceptFlow

void addAcceptFlow(IFlowNodeHandle source,
                   UUID remoteRepoIdentifier,
                   java.lang.String remoteRepoURI,
                   java.util.Collection componentScopes,
                   java.lang.String description)
Creates a flow entry (with description) adding the given workspace as an accept source, and declaring a list of component filters (can be empty) to be used when determining which change sets to be accepted.

Parameters:
source - flow node to serve as the accept source for the entry; cannot be null.
remoteRepoIdentifier - : the identifier which represents the repository id for the accept flow target if the the accept source is from a different repository
remoteRepoURI - : the expected repository uri which represents the URI for the accept flow target if the the accept source is from a different repository
componentScopes - collection (element type: IComponentHandle) which specify the additional component-scoped sources for flow; null implies no component scopes
description - client specified description to associate with this flow entry; null is permitted
Since:
0.7

removeDeliverFlow

void removeDeliverFlow(IFlowNodeHandle target)
Removes flow entries that have the given node as a deliver target.

Parameters:
target - flow node which is to be removed from all deliver flows; cannot be null.

removeAcceptFlow

void removeAcceptFlow(IFlowNodeHandle source)
Removes flow entries that have the given node as an accept source.

Parameters:
source - flow node which is to be removed from all accept flows; cannot be null.

removeAll

void removeAll(IFlowNodeHandle target)
Removes all flow entries that have the given node as a deliver target or as an accept source.

Parameters:
target - source or target flow node which is to be removed from all accept and accept flows; cannot be null.

getAcceptFlow

IFlowEntry getAcceptFlow(IFlowNodeHandle source)
Get the accept flow entry which has the specified flow node as an accept source.

Parameters:
source - flow node to serve as the accept source for the entry; cannot be null.
Returns:
the flow entry if it exists, null otherwise.

getAcceptFlow

IFlowEntry getAcceptFlow(IFlowNodeHandle source,
                         java.util.Collection componentScopes)
Get the accept flow entry which has the specified workspace & component scopes as an accept source.

Parameters:
source - flow node to serve as the accept source for the entry; cannot be null.
componentScopes - collection (element type: IComponentHandle) which specify the additional component-scoped sources for flow; cannot be null.
Returns:
the flow entry if it exists, null otherwise.

Returns:

setFlowEntryDescription

void setFlowEntryDescription(IFlowEntry entry,
                             java.lang.String description)
For the specified entry, set the specified flow entry's description attribute to the string value specified.

Parameters:
entry - a flow entry that exists in the table; cannot be null.
description - a description for the given flow entry

setCurrent

void setCurrent(IFlowEntry entry)
Indicates that the specified entry is the current one for the workspace for this direction (Accept or Deliver).

If there is already a current flow entry in this direction, it is cleared.

Parameters:
entry - a flow entry that exists in the table; cannot be null.

setCurrent

void setCurrent(IFlowEntry entry,
                IComponentHandle component)
Indicates that the specified entry is the current one for a particular component in the workspace for this direction (Accept or Deliver).

If there is already a current flow entry for this component in this direction, it is cleared.

Parameters:
entry - a flow entry that exists in the table; cannot be null.

                IComponentHandle component)

getComponentScopes

java.util.Collection getComponentScopes(IFlowNodeHandle node)
Returns the component scopes for the given flow node.

Parameters:
node - the flow node handle (not null)
Returns:
the unmodifiable collection of component scopes (element type: IComponentHandle) of the flow, never null, empty list means unscoped (i.e. process all components)

setComponentScopes

void setComponentScopes(IFlowNodeHandle node,
                        java.util.Collection componentScopes)
Sets the component scopes for the given flow node.

Parameters:
node - the flow node handle (not null)
componentScopes - the collection of component scopes (element type: IComponentHandle) of the flow, never null, empty list means unscoped (i.e. process all components)
